intro: Lophiolepis nerimaniae, commonly known as the Koa tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers that bloom in clusters. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in some areas.
